info.title: HCL Commerce Services - Marketing
info.description:
These services provide APIs related to marketing in either a B2B or B2C store. Use these classes to:
  • Get e-Marketing Spot data
  • Get customer segment data
  • Trigger marketing based on certain types of events
  • Get user marketing behavior data

tags.name: Spot
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to retrieve spot details.

tags.name: Event
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to trigger marketing based on certain types of events. For example, CategoryDisplay, ProductDisplay, or Search.

tags.name: Segment
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to retrieve the customer segment data

tags.name: User Behavior
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to get and delete user behavior for marketing purposes.

get.summary: Get e-Marketing Spots by unique identifier
get.description: Gets an e-Marketing Spot in a store using its unique identifier.

parameters.name: storeId
parameters.description: The store identifier.

parameters.name: spotId
parameters.description: E-Spot identifier.

parameters.name: responseFormat
parameters.description: The response format. Valid values are json and xml. If the request contains an input body, it must use the format specified in responseFormat. If the responseFormat is not specified, the accept  HTTP header determines the format of the response. If the accept  HTTP header is not specified then default response format is json.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Page number. Valid values are positive integers starting at 1. Use pageNumber with pageSize.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size. Used to limit the amount of data returned by a query. Valid values are integers starting with 1. Use pageSize with pageNumber.

get.description: "Deprecated: Gets an e-Marketing Spot at a specific category level. For example, Furniture. Alternatively, this can be implemented using the findByName method with the following URL: store/{storeId}/espot/{name}?categoryId=&DM_ReqCmd=CategoryDisplay."

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: E-Spot name.

parameters.name: storeId
parameters.description: The store identifier.

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: The category identifier.

parameters.name: responseFormat
parameters.description: The response format. If the request has an input body, that body must also use the format specified in "responseFormat". Valid values include "json" and "xml" without the quotes. If the responseFormat isn't specified, the "accept" HTTP header shall be used to determine the format of the response. If the "accept" HTTP header isn't specified as well, the default response format shall be in json.

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The catalog identifier. If none is specified, the store default catalog shall be used.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency code to use. Example usage : currency=USD. If no currency code is specified, the store default currency shall be used.

marketingContentDescription.marketingText:
Kids' Stuff
Summer style is all about fun prints, bright colors, comfort, and durability. Stock up on our easy-to-wear and affordable fashions for kids. Spend $100* or more, and earn a $25 gift certificate.
*Before taxes. Gift certificates are redeemable on your next visit.
shop now

get.summary: Get segments by user or store ID

parameters.description: The user's name. Required if the query is set to byName.

gettingstarted.content: Some REST services require authentication. HCL Commerce REST services are authenticated on secure and unsecured channels. This authentication can include the use of the WCToken and WCTrustedToken. To use REST services that require authentication, you must first get authentication data by using a supported identity services. After you obtain the authentication data, you must pass either the WCToken or WCTustedToken parameters, or both, within the HTTP header for every request that requires authentication. If a request is sent over HTTP, pass the WCToken parameter in the HTTP header. Do not pass the WCTrustedToken in HTTP requests, as the parameter value might display. Send both the WCToken and the WCTrustedToken parameters when the request is being sent over HTTPS. The HCL Commerce REST APIs can also use session cookies that are created by the HCL Commerce store runtime for authentication. These cookies allow you to mix requests to the HCL Commerce REST APIs and the HCL Commerce store runtime within the same user session. See more here:
gettingstarted.name: Authentication

gettingstarted.content: HCL Commerce REST services support JSON and XML formats for input and output data by default. The default format is JSON. When an XML String is sent to a REST service, you must set Content-Type HTTP header to be "application/xml". The REST service converts the XML input data to the JSON format that is accepted by REST services. Therefore, your input XML format must follow a certain structure so that it can be transformed to the JSON object that is accepted by REST services. See more here:
gettingstarted.name: Response formats

gettingstarted.content: Preview tokens are encrypted strings that encapsulates a set of preview options and restrictions on when and where the token can be used. Any user who is authorized to access your server and has a preview token, can complete preview actions in the same store for which that token is generated. See more here:
gettingstarted.name: Preview tokens

gettingstarted.content: Some HCL Commerce REST services require a request to be sent over HTTPS. Learn more here:
gettingstarted.name: Secure Sockets Layer
